cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +1/+2.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

cards.originalText: You may decline to draw a card from your library during draw phase. In exchange, until start of your next turn the only creatures that may attack you are those that fly or have islandwalk.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

cards.originalText: For each swamp in play, Karma does 1 damage to the swamp owner during the swamp owner's upkeep.

cards.name: Lance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains first strike.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Flying, bands

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
—The Book of Tal
cards.originalText: {W}{W}: and tap: Destroys a black card in play. Cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Caster can redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. The source of the damage is unchanged. If Personal Incarnation is destroyed, caster loses half his or her remaining life points, rounding up the loss.

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to white. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from red.

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Take a creature from your graveyard and put it directly into play. You can't tap it until your next turn.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.originalText: All damage you have taken from any one source this turn is added to your life total instead of subtracted from it.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.originalText: Target defending creature gains +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: Tap to prevent 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Does not tap when attacking.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Target creature is removed from game entirely; return to owner's deck only when game is over. Creature's controller gains life points equal to creature's power.

cards.name: Veteran Bodyguard
cards.text: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.
cards.flavor: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

rulings.text: If a creature is blocked but Trample damage is still done to a player, this damage can't be redirected to the Bodyguard because the Bodyguard only takes damage from unblocked creatures.
Damage goes to the Bodyguard as long as he is untapped. This works even if he is blocking.
If you have multiple Veteran Bodyguards, you can decide which one receives the redirected damage each time damage would be dealt to you.

cards.originalText: Unless Bodyguard is tapped, any damage done to you by unblocked creatures is done instead to Bodyguard. You may not take this damage yourself, though you can prevent it if possible.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
cards.originalText: Protection from black, first strike

cards.name: White Ward

Enchant creature

cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from white.

cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: All creatures in play are destroyed and cannot regenerate.

rulings.text: Land type changing effects that change a dual land's land type will remove the old land types completely. Text-changing effects that just change one of the two land types will leave the other type unaffected.
This card is a Mountain and a Swamp even while in the graveyard, library, or any other zone.
This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.originalText: Counts as both mountains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {R} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ancestor's Chosen
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "The will of all, by my hand done."
cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen comes into play, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Angelic Chorus
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

rulings.text: This does not trigger on a permanent being turned into a creature. That is just a permanent changing type, not something entering the battlefield.
Angelic Chorus does not trigger when creatures phase in or change controllers.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Angelic Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor:
"The Ancestor protects us in ways we can't begin to comprehend."
—Mystic elder
cards.originalText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Aura of Silence
cards.text:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Not all silences are easily broken.

rulings.text: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

cards.originalText:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents play cost {2} more to play.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Aven Cloudchaser
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"At the Reapportionment, Eagle begged to be human. The Ancestor granted half that prayer."
—Nomad myth
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) 
When Aven Cloudchaser comes into play, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Ballista Squad
cards.text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.
cards.originalText: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Bandage
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is measured in inches. To a healer, every one of those inches is precious.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Beacon of Immortality
cards.text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

rulings.text: If you double a negative life total, you do the real math. A life total of -10 becomes -20.
Beacon of Immortality's effect counts as life gain (or life loss, if the life total was negative) for effects that trigger on or replace life gain (or life loss).
If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.

cards.name: Benalish Knight
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"We called them 'armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.
cards.flavor: "Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.

cards.name: Condemn
cards.text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: The affected creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

cards.originalText: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Demystify
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Illusion is a crutch for those with no grounding in reality."
—Cho-Manno
cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Field Marshal
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: He is the only one who sees the patterns in the overlapping maps and conflicting reports.
cards.originalText: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Ghost Warden
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Hail of Arrows
cards.text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

rulings.text: You choose how the damage will be divided among the target creatures at the time you cast Hail of Arrows. Each target must be dealt at least 1 damage. If any of those creatures becomes an illegal target before Hail of Arrows resolves, the division of damage among the remaining creatures doesn't change.

cards.originalText: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.

cards.name: Heart of Light
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: High Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.

rulings.text: High Ground's effect is cumulative. If you have a creature that can already block an additional creature, now it can block three creatures.

High Ground allows you to make some complicated blocks. For example, if you're being attacked by three creatures (call them A, B, and C) and you control three creatures (X, Y, and Z), you can have X block A and B, Y block B and C, and Z block just C, among many other possible options. The defending player chooses how each blocking creature's combat damage will be divided among the creatures it's blocking.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Holy Day
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.flavor:
"May angels fly at your back. May your blade cleave the darkness."
—War blessing of Serra
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Honor Guard
cards.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.
cards.originalText: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Icatian Priest
cards.text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor: Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

foreignNames.name: キイェルドーの近衛隊

cards.originalText: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

cards.name: Loxodon Mystic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Loyal Sentry
cards.text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.
cards.flavor: "My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."

rulings.text: Loyal Sentry and the creature it blocks are destroyed before combat damage is dealt. The blocked creature is destroyed even if Loyal Sentry leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

cards.name: Luminesce
cards.text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.

cards.name: Mobilization
cards.text:
Soldier creatures have vigilance.
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
cards.flavor: Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.
cards.originalText:
Soldier creatures have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
{2}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token into play.

cards.name: Nomad Mythmaker
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: On the wild steppes, history vanishes in the dust. Only the mythmakers remain to say what was, and is, and will be.

rulings.text: You don't choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. (For example, you can't choose a creature with protection from black if the targeted Aura card is black.) If you don't control any creatures that the Aura can enchant, it remains in the graveyard.
Nomad Mythmaker's ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card in a graveyard into play attached to a creature you control. (You control that Aura.)

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Paladin en-Vec
cards.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
cards.flavor: "I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black, protection from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

cards.name: Pariah
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
cards.flavor:
"Why would I consider penance for my actions when I have so many subjects willing to do it for me?"
—Lord Konda

rulings.text: You can attach this to an opponent's creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

cards.name: Reviving Dose
cards.text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.
cards.originalText:

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

rulings.text: A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.originalText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rule of Law
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.
cards.originalText: Each player can't play more than one spell each turn.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.originalText: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.originalText: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: "We are all inextricably linked, souls woven in tapestry."

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
